metadata.title: CVE-2024-42264 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/v3d: Prevent out of bounds access in performance query extensionsCheck that the number of perfmons userspace is passing in the copy andreset extensions is not greater than the internal kernel storage wherethe ids will be copied into.(cherry picked from commit f32b5128d2c440368b5bf3a7a356823e235caabb)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42264` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
